intro: Ellipanthus mindanaensis, commonly known as the Mindanao bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas within montane forests, preferring cool and humid conditions. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom during the rainy season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
